test_cases.name: Successfully generate carousel from valid topic with default parameters
test_cases.description: Validates the complete AI generation pipeline can create carousel slides from a topic description
test_cases.business_context: Topic-based generation is the core feature of QuickCarousals. Users must be able to provide a topic and receive professionally structured slides ready for editing.
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid session
User has a Profile record in database

steps.action: Send POST request to /api/generate/topic with body: {"topic": "5 productivity tips for remote workers"}
steps.expected: API accepts request and begins generation process

steps.action: Wait for response (AI generation takes 10-30 seconds)
steps.expected: Step 1: generateSlidePlan creates structured plan with hook, promise, value, recap, CTA slides

steps.action: Verify step 2 of AI pipeline executes
steps.expected: Step 2: generateSlideCopy creates detailed copy for each slide with headlines and body bullets

steps.action: Verify step 3 of AI pipeline executes
steps.expected: Step 3: selectLayoutsForSlides maps each slide to appropriate layoutId from TemplateLayout table
Response status is 200 OK
Response contains: {slides: [...], metadata: {topic, tone, slideCount, generatedAt}}
slides array contains 10 slides (default), each with: orderIndex, slideType, layoutId, headline, body, emphasis

acceptance_criteria: Response status code is 200
Response time is under 45 seconds (AI generation is slow)
slides array contains exactly 10 slides (default slideCount)
Each slide has orderIndex from 0 to 9
First slide has slideType 'hook', last slide has slideType 'cta'
All layoutId values exist in TemplateLayout table (hook_big_headline, promise_two_column, value_bullets, recap_grid, cta_centered, etc.)
All headlines are 8-12 words or less
All body arrays contain 3-5 items or less
metadata.topic matches input topic
metadata.tone is 'professional' (default)
metadata.generatedAt is valid ISO timestamp
test_cases.notes: This is the primary happy path for carousel generation. The AI pipeline has 3 steps and takes significant time. Default tone is 'professional', default slideCount is 10.

test_cases.name: Generate carousel with custom slideCount parameter
test_cases.description: Validates that slideCount parameter controls the number of generated slides within allowed range (8-12)
test_cases.business_context: Users should be able to control carousel length. Some topics need more slides (12), others work better with fewer (8).

steps.action: Send POST request with {"topic": "Git workflow basics", "slideCount": 8}
steps.expected: API accepts slideCount parameter
AI generates exactly 8 slides
slides.length === 8

steps.action: Send POST request with {"topic": "Advanced SEO strategies", "slideCount": 12}
steps.expected: API accepts slideCount: 12
AI generates exactly 12 slides
slides.length === 12
metadata.slideCount matches request parameter

acceptance_criteria: slideCount: 8 produces 8 slides
slideCount: 12 produces 12 slides
slideCount: 10 (default) produces 10 slides
metadata.slideCount accurately reflects generated count
All slides have sequential orderIndex (0 to n-1)
Slide types are properly distributed (hook, promise, value, recap, cta)
Response time scales with slideCount (more slides = longer time)
test_cases.notes: Schema validation: slideCount must be int between 8-12 inclusive. Default is 10 if not specified.

test_cases.business_context: Different audiences and topics require different tones. Professional tone for B2B, bold for viral content, calm for educational, contrarian for thought leadership.

steps.expected: AI uses bold, attention-grabbing language in headlines and copy

steps.action: Generate with tone: 'calm' - POST {"topic": "Mindfulness techniques for busy professionals", "tone": "calm"}

Each tone produces noticeably different language style

test_cases.name: API handles OpenAI timeout errors gracefully
test_cases.description: Validates that API properly handles and reports OpenAI timeout errors with user-friendly messages
test_cases.business_context: OpenAI API can be slow or unresponsive. Users need clear feedback when generation times out so they can retry.
preconditions: OpenAI API is slow or timing out (simulate with long topic or network issues)

steps.action: Send POST request with valid topic that might cause timeout (very complex or long topic)
steps.expected: API begins generation process

steps.expected: OpenAI request times out after 30 seconds
Response status is 500 Internal Server Error
Response contains: {"error": {"code": "INTERNAL_ERROR", "message": "AI generation timed out. Please try again."}}
Error handler at line 185-186 detects 'timeout' in error message
Server logs: 'OpenAI generation error: [timeout details]'

acceptance_criteria: Timeout errors return 500 status code
Error message is user-friendly: 'AI generation timed out. Please try again.'
Error code is 'INTERNAL_ERROR'
Original error is logged to console for debugging
Response contains no technical details (API keys, stack traces)
Timeout detection works by checking error.message for 'timeout' substring
User is encouraged to retry (message says 'Please try again')

test_cases.description: Validates the FASTEST possible path from landing page to download for a new user who accepts all defaults and doesn't customize anything. This tests the '3 minutes' promise from marketing.
test_cases.business_context: QuickCarousals promises 'Turn an idea into a LinkedIn-ready carousel in 3 minutes'. This is the core value proposition on the landing page. If a power user who clicks through quickly can't get a PDF in 3 minutes, the promise is false and trust is lost.

acceptance_criteria: TOTAL TIME: From landing page load to PDF download trigger is under 180 seconds (3 minutes)

BREAKDOWN: User actions (typing, clicking) = ~20 seconds, Page loads/transitions = ~10 seconds, AI generation = 20-45 seconds, Export processing = 10-30 seconds, Total budget: ~60-105 seconds (well under 3 min if systems fast)
NO DELAYS: No artificial loading delays, no unnecessary confirmation dialogs, no multi-step forms
DEFAULTS WORK: Default topic mode, default 10 slides, default Professional tone, default PDF format, default filename all work without customization

test_cases.notes: This test validates the '3 minutes' marketing promise. It's the SPEED-FOCUSED variant of TC-JOURNEY-001. If this test fails (time exceeds 3 minutes), the marketing copy must be updated or system performance must be improved. Key performance bottlenecks: 1) AI generation (20-45s, can't optimize much), 2) Export rendering (10-30s, can optimize with better canvas code or parallel processing), 3) Clerk webhook delay (1-5s, can't control). Best-case total: 50s, worst-case total: 105s, both well under 3 minutes IF systems are fast. If AI is slow (45s) AND export is slow (30s), we're at 75s + 30s overhead = 105s = 1:45, still under promise. This test should be run regularly to ensure performance doesn't degrade.

test_cases.business_context: Not all users are power users. Most new users will explore the interface, hover over tooltips, try different options, and preview changes before committing. This realistic behavior must be supported without breaking the flow or causing confusion.
preconditions: User has no existing QuickCarousals account
User is cautious and curious (reads before clicking)

steps.action: Navigate to landing page, scroll down to read Features Grid (AI-Powered, 8 Style Kits, Visual Editor, Export Ready)
steps.expected: Page scrolls smoothly, all feature cards visible with icons and descriptions

steps.action: Click 'View Pricing' secondary CTA to understand pricing before signing up
steps.expected: Navigate to /en/pricing. Pricing page loads showing 3 tiers (FREE/CREATOR/PRO) with features and prices. NOTE: Current pricing shows WRONG features (Kubernetes clusters), but user may not notice.

steps.action: Click browser back button to return to landing page
steps.expected: Browser navigates back to /en, landing page loads again

steps.action: Click 'Start Creating Free' to begin signup
steps.expected: Navigate to /en/register

steps.action: Complete registration and land on dashboard empty state
steps.expected: Dashboard shows empty state with 'Create Your First Carousel' CTA

steps.action: Read the empty state message ('No carousels yet', 'It only takes 3 minutes!')
steps.expected: User sees encouragement text, builds confidence to proceed
Navigate to /en/create

steps.action: On create page, hover over 'Text' mode tab to see what it does
steps.expected: Cursor changes to pointer, tab highlights slightly on hover (visual feedback)

steps.action: Click 'Text' mode tab to switch modes
steps.expected: Text mode becomes active (blue highlight), topic input disappears, text textarea appears with placeholder 'Paste your text here... (10-10,000 characters)', character count shows '0/10,000'
Topic mode becomes active, text textarea disappears, topic input appears

steps.action: Click slide count dropdown to see options
steps.expected: Dropdown expands showing options: 8, 9, 10, 11, 12 (FREE tier only sees 8). Current value '10' is highlighted.

steps.action: Hover over slide count '8' without selecting
steps.expected: Option highlights on hover (visual feedback)
Dropdown closes, selected value changes to '8', UI updates to show '8 slides'

steps.action: Click tone selector dropdown to see options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows: Professional (selected), Bold, Calm, Contrarian
Dropdown closes, tone changes to 'Bold', UI updates

steps.action: Notice 'Apply Brand Kit' toggle, hover to see tooltip (if present)
steps.expected: Toggle is OFF by default. Tooltip explains brand kit feature (if tooltip implemented).

steps.action: Try to toggle 'Apply Brand Kit' ON
steps.expected: If user has 0 brand kits (FREE tier default), toggle either stays OFF or shows message 'No brand kits available. Create one in Settings.'

steps.action: Scroll down to see style kit preview (if visible on create page)
steps.expected: If style kit selector is on create page, user sees preview of minimal_clean (default). If not on create page, this step is skipped.

steps.action: Enter topic in input field: '7 tips for better sleep hygiene'
steps.expected: Text appears, character count updates to '37/500', Generate button enables

steps.action: Read the Generate button text carefully before clicking
steps.expected: Button says 'Generate Carousel', clear call to action
Loading state starts, button disables, spinner appears

steps.action: Wait for generation with customized settings (8 slides, Bold tone)
steps.expected: AI generates 8 slides instead of default 10, with Bold tone copy (shorter, punchier headlines)

steps.action: After redirect to editor, hover over thumbnail rail slide thumbnails to see preview
steps.expected: Thumbnails show mini preview of each slide (108x135px), hovering shows gray background (visual feedback)

steps.action: Click each slide thumbnail sequentially (1→2→3→4→5→6→7→8) to preview all slides
steps.expected: Canvas updates to show each slide's content. Total of 8 slides (not 10), all rendered correctly.

steps.action: On slide 3, click on headline text in canvas to edit
steps.expected: Textarea overlay appears at exact position of text on canvas, current headline text is pre-filled, cursor focuses in textarea
Text updates in textarea, character count updates

steps.action: Click outside textarea to close editor
steps.expected: Textarea disappears, canvas updates with new text 'Pro Tip 3', auto-fit algorithm recalculates font size
After 500ms, PUT /api/projects/[id]/slides executes automatically, saves all slides including edited slide 3

steps.action: Open theme controls (right sidebar) and click color picker for background
steps.expected: Color picker dropdown opens, shows current background color selected

steps.action: Select a different background color (e.g., light blue #e0f2ff)
steps.expected: Canvas immediately updates with new background color on current slide (no save required), color applies to styleKit

steps.action: Click through other slides to see if color applied globally
steps.expected: Background color change applies to ALL slides (styleKit update affects entire project)
ExportModal opens

steps.action: In ExportModal, hover over 'PNG' format button to see difference
steps.expected: PNG button highlights on hover, shows it's clickable
PNG becomes selected (active state), PDF becomes unselected
PDF becomes selected again
Checkbox becomes checked (visual checkmark appears)

steps.action: Edit filename field from default to 'SleepTips_LinkedIn'
steps.expected: Text field accepts input, filename updates
Export starts, creates 2 exports (PDF + thumbnail PNG), modal shows progress
Both exports complete, modal shows 'Download PDF' button
PDF downloads with 8 pages, includes edited 'Pro Tip 3' text, light blue background on all slides, watermark present

acceptance_criteria: USER FLOW: All exploration actions work correctly (mode switching, dropdown selections, toggles, color pickers)
VISUAL FEEDBACK: All interactive elements provide hover states, active states, loading states
CUSTOMIZATION: User's choices persist through the journey (8 slides, Bold tone, edited text, changed color all present in final PDF)
NO CONFUSION: No broken UI states, no elements that appear clickable but don't work, no tooltips that say 'coming soon'
REAL-TIME UPDATES: Canvas updates immediately on color change, auto-save works after text edit, thumbnail rail updates on slide changes
THUMBNAIL ACCURACY: Slide thumbnails match actual slide content (not generic placeholders)
EXPORT OPTIONS: Checkbox for cover thumbnail works, filename customization works, format switching works
FINAL OUTPUT: PDF has 8 pages (not default 10), includes custom edits, shows bold tone copy, shows custom background color
AUTO-SAVE: After text edit, wait confirms PUT /api/projects/[id]/slides executes automatically without explicit save button
NO ERRORS: Browser console has zero errors despite extensive clicking/hovering/exploring
test_cases.notes: This test represents REALISTIC new user behavior - not rushing, but exploring and learning the interface. Key insights: 1) Users will try different options before committing, 2) Hover states and visual feedback are critical for confidence, 3) Customizations must persist through the entire flow (no loss of settings), 4) Auto-save must work transparently (no explicit save button needed). This test is longer (40 steps) because it includes exploration actions. If this test reveals confusion points (e.g., toggle doesn't work, color doesn't apply), those are UX bugs that harm onboarding success. Current known gaps: pricing page shows wrong features (may confuse user in step 2), brand kit toggle behavior unclear (step 17). Time budget for this user: 10-15 minutes (includes reading and exploring).

test_cases.name: Topic to Export - Complete Happy Path (Comprehensive Validation)
test_cases.description: Validates the COMPLETE topic-to-export journey from create page through PDF download. This is THE core user flow - if this breaks, the product is broken. Tests every critical touchpoint: topic entry, AI generation (20-45s), editor load, canvas rendering, auto-save, theme customization, export job queue (10-30s), and file download.
test_cases.business_context: This is the PRIMARY value proposition of QuickCarousals: 'Turn an idea into a LinkedIn-ready carousel in 3 minutes'. If users cannot complete this flow successfully, the business fails. This journey represents the user's first success moment and determines retention.
preconditions: User is logged in as FREE tier
OpenAI API key configured and valid
PostgreSQL database running and seeded with StyleKits and TemplateLayouts

steps.expected: Create page loads with Topic mode selected by default, text input visible, slide count dropdown showing only 8 (FREE tier limit), tone selector showing 4 options (professional/bold/calm/contrarian), brand kit toggle disabled (0 kits for FREE)

steps.action: Enter topic: '5 productivity tips for remote workers' (53 characters, within 1-500 limit)
steps.expected: Text appears in input field character-by-character, no validation errors, generate button becomes enabled

steps.action: Leave slide count at default 10, tone at default 'professional', brand kit toggle off
steps.expected: UI shows selected values, no changes trigger errors

steps.action: Open style kit selector dropdown, verify 3 free kits visible: minimal_clean, bold_modern, elegant_serif
steps.expected: Dropdown opens with 3 style kits in Free section, 5 premium kits grayed out with 'Premium' badges. Preview cards show colors and fonts. No console errors.
Style kit selector updates to show 'bold_modern' selected, dropdown closes
Button becomes disabled, loading spinner appears, button text changes to 'Generating...', pulsing animation starts on button

steps.action: Wait for AI generation to complete (expect 20-45 seconds for 3-stage pipeline: slide plan → slide copy → layout selection)
steps.expected: Loading state persists throughout generation. No timeout errors. After completion, browser redirects to /en/editor/[new-project-id]

steps.action: Verify editor page loads with generated slides
steps.expected: Editor page loads within 2 seconds. ThumbnailRail shows 10 thumbnails (1-indexed display). EditorCanvas displays first slide at 1080x1350 with scaled content. Header shows 'Saving...' then 'All changes saved'. No console errors.

steps.action: Inspect generated content structure: verify slide types (hook, promise, value slides, recap, cta), verify each slide has headline, body, appropriate layout
steps.expected: All 10 slides present with correct slide types. Each slide renders text content, no empty slides, no overflow warnings (red borders). Layouts match slide types (hook_big_headline for hook, promise_two_column for promise, etc.)

steps.action: Click on slide 3 thumbnail in ThumbnailRail
steps.expected: Slide 3 thumbnail gets blue border/shadow (active state). EditorCanvas updates to show slide 3 content. ThemeControls and LayoutVariantSelector update to reflect slide 3 data. Transition is smooth (<500ms).

steps.action: Click on a text box in EditorCanvas
steps.expected: Text box shows blue outline. Textarea overlay appears at exact scaled position. Text is editable. Rewrite menu appears with 4 actions (shorter, punchier, examples, reduce_jargon).

steps.action: Edit text: change 'Tip #3' headline to 'Pro Tip #3' (add 4 characters)
steps.expected: Text updates in real-time in textarea. Auto-fit algorithm recalculates font size (binary search, <100ms). Canvas re-renders with new text. No overflow detected (height still fits bounds).

steps.action: Click outside textarea to close text editing
steps.expected: Textarea overlay closes. Edited text persists on canvas. Auto-save triggers after 500ms debounce. Header shows 'Saving...' briefly, then 'All changes saved'.

steps.action: Wait 2 seconds for auto-save to complete, then refresh browser page
steps.expected: Browser reloads editor page. All 10 slides reload from database. Slide 3 shows 'Pro Tip #3' headline change persisted. No data loss.

steps.action: Open ThemeControls, click on background color picker
steps.expected: Color picker dropdown opens with color input and hex text input. Current background color is selected.

steps.action: Change background color from default to #1a202c (dark gray)
steps.expected: Color picker updates, hex input shows #1a202c. EditorCanvas immediately re-renders all visible slide content with new background. Auto-save triggers. Header shows 'Saving...' then 'All changes saved'.

Selector fetches layouts from GET /api/layouts on first open (if not cached). Displays only layouts matching current slide's slideType. Shows 3-column grid with mini previews (8% scale). Active layout has blue border.

steps.action: Select a different layout variant for current slide
steps.expected: Layout preview gets blue border. EditorCanvas re-renders slide with new layout (layersBlueprint changes). Text content remaps to new layer structure. Auto-fit recalculates for all text boxes. Auto-save triggers.

steps.action: Click zoom in button (+) in EditorCanvas toolbar
steps.expected: Canvas zoom increases (e.g., 100% → 125%). Scale calculation updates. Pan controls become enabled (grab cursor). Canvas content enlarges proportionally. No pixelation (vector rendering).

steps.action: Pan canvas by clicking and dragging
steps.expected: Canvas content moves with mouse. Cursor shows 'grabbing' state. Pan position updates in real-time. Canvas does not pan off-screen completely (though no bounds enforcement currently).
Zoom resets to base scale (fills container width/height), pan resets to (0,0). Canvas centers in viewport. Transition is smooth.

steps.action: Navigate to last slide (slide 10 - CTA slide) via ThumbnailRail
steps.expected: EditorCanvas shows CTA slide with layout cta_centered. Slide displays call-to-action text. No rendering issues.

steps.action: Verify FREE tier watermark visible: 'QuickCarousals.com' at (540, 1320) in light gray rgba(0,0,0,0.4)
steps.expected: Watermark text renders on canvas at bottom-center. Text is semi-transparent, non-intrusive but visible. Watermark is part of canvas layer, not UI overlay.
ExportModal opens showing configuration screen. Two format buttons (PDF/PNG), filename input pre-filled with 'Carousel - [date]', cover thumbnail checkbox. No loading state yet.

steps.action: Verify filename input shows project title or default filename
steps.expected: Filename input contains text (e.g., '5 productivity tips for remote workers' or 'Carousel - Feb 01, 2026'). Input is editable.

steps.action: Leave PDF format selected (default), leave cover thumbnail unchecked, click 'Start Export' button
steps.expected: Button becomes disabled. API call: POST /api/exports with projectId, exportType='PDF', filename. Response returns exportId. Modal transitions to progress screen showing 'PENDING' status (25% progress bar).

steps.action: Wait for export status polling (2-second interval). Watch status transitions: PENDING → PROCESSING → COMPLETED
steps.expected: Progress screen shows polling status. Status updates from PENDING (25%) to PROCESSING (75%). Background worker fetches slides, renders each to PNG using @napi-rs/canvas, generates PDF using PDFKit, uploads to Supabase Storage. After 10-30 seconds, status changes to COMPLETED (100%).
Progress bar shows 100%. Success message appears. 'Download PDF' button is enabled and visible. No error messages.

API call: GET /api/exports/[exportId] returns signed URL (24h expiry) from Supabase Storage. Browser triggers download (programmatic <a> click with download attribute). PDF file downloads to user's Downloads folder.

steps.action: Open downloaded PDF file in system PDF viewer (Preview/Adobe/Browser)
steps.expected: PDF opens successfully. Contains 10 pages (one per slide). Each page is 1080x1350 (portrait). Content matches editor canvas exactly. Colors correct (#1a202c background). Text readable, no cut-off. Watermark 'QuickCarousals.com' visible on every page at bottom-center. PDF file size reasonable (500KB - 2MB for 10 slides).

steps.action: Close ExportModal, navigate back to dashboard via 'Dashboard' link in header
steps.expected: Browser navigates to /en/dashboard. Dashboard shows 1 project card with title '5 productivity tips for remote workers', status badge 'DRAFT' (yellow), last updated timestamp. No empty state message.

steps.action: Click on project card to return to editor
steps.expected: Navigate to /en/editor/[project-id]. Editor loads with all 10 slides, theme changes persisted (dark background), text edits persisted ('Pro Tip #3'). Auto-save header shows 'All changes saved'.

acceptance_criteria: SPEED: Total journey time from step 1 to step 30 is under 5 minutes (3-minute promise + buffer for realistic user pace)
AI GENERATION: Completes within 45 seconds, generates exactly 10 slides with correct types (hook/promise/value/recap/cta)
EDITOR LOAD: Editor page loads in under 2 seconds after generation redirects
CANVAS RENDERING: All slides render at 1080x1350 with no overflow errors, text is readable
AUTO-SAVE: All edits (text changes, theme changes, layout changes) persist after 500ms debounce, survive page refresh
EXPORT QUEUE: Export job completes within 30 seconds, no job failures
PDF QUALITY: Downloaded PDF has 10 pages, correct dimensions, colors match editor, text is not cut off, watermark present on all pages
DATABASE INTEGRITY: Project record created with correct userId, styleKitId. All 10 Slide records created with correct projectId, layoutId, orderIndex 0-9. Export record created with status COMPLETED.
STORAGE: PDF file uploaded to Supabase Storage at path {userId}/{filename}.pdf, file is accessible via signed URL
ERROR ABSENCE: No console errors throughout entire journey, no 500 API responses, no unhandled promise rejections
UI RESPONSIVENESS: All interactions (clicks, typing, zoom, pan) feel responsive (<100ms feedback), no janky animations
FREE TIER ENFORCEMENT: Slide count limited to 8 in dropdown, brand kit toggle disabled, watermark present on export, only 3 style kits visible in selector
test_cases.notes: This test represents the COMPLETE user value proposition. All 32 steps must pass for product to function. Journey touches 8+ modules (auth, generation, creation, editor, export, storage, queue, database). If any step fails, entire product experience is broken. Test should be automated with Playwright for regression testing.

test_cases.name: Topic to Export - Error Recovery Path (Generation Failure)
test_cases.description: Validates error handling when AI generation FAILS due to OpenAI API errors (rate limit, timeout, invalid response). Tests that user receives clear error message, can retry generation, and system recovers gracefully without corrupting database state.
test_cases.business_context: AI generation failures will happen in production (OpenAI downtime, rate limits, network issues). Users must NOT lose their input or think the product is broken. Clear error messaging and retry capability are critical for retention.
preconditions: User is logged in as FREE tier
OpenAI API is experiencing issues (simulated or real rate limit/timeout)

steps.action: Enter valid topic: 'Best practices for remote team collaboration' (50 characters)
steps.expected: Topic input accepts text, no validation errors, generate button enabled

steps.action: Select style kit 'minimal_clean', leave defaults for slide count (10) and tone (professional)
steps.expected: UI shows selections, no errors

steps.action: Click 'Generate' button to trigger generation that will FAIL
steps.expected: Button disables, loading spinner appears, button text changes to 'Generating...'

steps.action: Wait for OpenAI API to fail (could be 429 rate limit after 10s, or timeout after 30s, or validation error immediately)
steps.expected: After error occurs (10-30 seconds), loading state stops. Error banner appears at top of create page with RED background showing error message like 'Generation failed. Please try again.' or 'OpenAI rate limit exceeded. Try again in a few minutes.'

steps.action: Verify user input is PRESERVED after error (topic text still in input, style kit still selected, options unchanged)
steps.expected: All form inputs retain their values. User does NOT need to re-enter topic or re-select options. Generate button is re-enabled.

steps.action: Verify no project record created in database (check /api/projects list is empty)
steps.expected: Navigate to /en/dashboard, verify empty state still shows. API call GET /api/projects returns empty array []. No orphaned project or slide records in database.

steps.action: Return to /en/create, verify error message persists if user doesn't dismiss it
steps.expected: Error banner still visible if not explicitly closed. User can see what went wrong.

steps.action: Close error banner by clicking X or dismiss button
steps.expected: Error banner closes, disappears from UI. No error state in console.

steps.action: Wait 30 seconds (simulated wait for rate limit to clear), then click 'Generate' again with SAME inputs
steps.expected: Generation starts again. Loading state shows. If OpenAI API is now working, generation succeeds and redirects to editor. If still failing, error banner reappears with updated error message.

steps.action: If retry succeeds: verify editor loads with generated slides, all 10 slides present, no corruption from previous failed attempt
steps.expected: Editor loads successfully. ThumbnailRail shows 10 slides. EditorCanvas renders first slide. Auto-save shows 'All changes saved'. Database has 1 project + 10 slides (no orphaned records from failed attempt).

acceptance_criteria: ERROR MESSAGING: Clear, user-friendly error message appears within 3 seconds of failure. Message explains what happened (rate limit, timeout, API error) in plain English.
INPUT PRESERVATION: Topic text, style kit selection, slide count, tone all PERSIST after error. User does not need to re-enter data.
NO DATABASE CORRUPTION: Failed generation does NOT create orphaned project or slide records. Database state is clean (no partial data).
RETRY CAPABILITY: Generate button re-enables after error. User can click Generate again without page refresh.
ERROR DISMISSAL: User can close error banner. Error state does not persist after dismissal unless generation fails again.
SUCCESS AFTER RETRY: If retry succeeds, journey continues normally (editor loads, slides created, auto-save works).
NO MEMORY LEAKS: Failed generation does not cause memory leaks or hanging promises. Browser console shows no unhandled promise rejections.
API RESPONSE LOGGING: OpenAI API errors are logged server-side (for debugging) but NOT exposed to client (no API keys or stack traces in client error messages).
test_cases.notes: This test validates product resilience. AI APIs WILL fail - the question is whether the product handles it gracefully. User retention depends on clear error messages and easy recovery. Test with simulated OpenAI errors (mock API responses) or real rate limit conditions.

test_cases.name: Topic to Export - Premium Features Upgrade Prompts (FREE → CREATOR Conversion)
test_cases.description: Validates that FREE tier users encounter appropriate upgrade prompts during topic-to-export journey when trying to access premium features: 15 slides, premium style kits, brand kits. Tests that prompts are CLEAR, NON-INTRUSIVE, and ACTIONABLE (link to /settings/billing). This is a critical conversion funnel test.
test_cases.business_context: FREE tier is intentionally limited to encourage upgrades. Upgrade prompts must be visible but not annoying, clear but not pushy, actionable but not blocking. Conversion rate from FREE → CREATOR is a key business metric.
preconditions: User is logged in as FREE tier (subscriptionTier = 'FREE')
User has used 2 of 3 carousel limit (projectCount = 2)

steps.action: Verify carousel limit warning banner shows at top of create page: 'You have 2 of 3 carousels. Upgrade to Creator for 30 carousels.'
steps.expected: Yellow/orange banner visible at top with warning icon, clear text, and 'Upgrade' link to /settings/billing. Banner is noticeable but not blocking.

steps.action: Enter topic: 'Complete guide to productivity' (33 characters)
steps.expected: Topic input accepts text, no validation errors

steps.action: Open slide count dropdown, verify only '8' option is available (FREE tier limit), no higher options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows only '8 slides' option. No 9, 10, 11, etc. Tooltip or disabled options show 'Upgrade to Creator for up to 15 slides'.

steps.action: Open style kit selector, verify 3 free kits (minimal_clean, high_contrast_punch, marker_highlight, sticky_note) and 5 premium kits grayed out
steps.expected: Style kit dropdown shows Free section (4 kits, clickable) and Premium section (4 kits, grayed out with 'Premium' badge). Premium kits have cursor: not-allowed. Hovering premium kit shows tooltip 'Upgrade to Creator for all style kits'.

steps.action: Try to click on a premium style kit (e.g., 'gradient_modern')
steps.expected: Click is blocked (cursor: not-allowed, no selection). Tooltip remains visible. Subtle animation or feedback indicates kit is unavailable. No console errors.

steps.action: Verify brand kit toggle is DISABLED (opacity 0.5, cursor: not-allowed)
steps.expected: Brand kit toggle is grayed out. Tooltip or inline text shows 'Brand kits require Creator or Pro plan'.

steps.action: Click 'Learn More' link in brand kit section (if present) or hover for tooltip
steps.expected: Tooltip or modal explains: 'Brand kits let you add your logo, colors, and fonts. Available on Creator ($X/mo) and Pro ($Y/mo) plans. Upgrade in Settings > Billing.'

steps.action: Select a free style kit (minimal_clean), leave slide count at 8, click Generate
steps.expected: Generation starts normally. Loading state shows. After 20-45 seconds, redirects to editor with 8 slides (not 10, respecting FREE tier limit).

steps.action: In editor, verify slide count is 8 (not 10), verify Add Slide button shows upgrade tooltip
steps.expected: ThumbnailRail shows 8 thumbnails. Add Slide button (+) is visible but clicking shows tooltip: 'FREE tier allows up to 8 slides. Upgrade to Creator for 15 slides.' Button does NOT create new slide.

steps.action: Open ThemeControls, verify all color/font customization IS available (not gated)
steps.expected: Color pickers work, font selectors work. FREE tier CAN customize themes within current slide count limit.

steps.action: Complete export to PDF (same steps as TC-JOURNEY-TOPIC-001 steps 24-30)
steps.expected: Export succeeds. PDF downloads with 8 pages. Watermark 'QuickCarousals.com' present on all pages (FREE tier watermark enforcement).

steps.action: After export, in ExportModal or header, verify watermark explanation text or upgrade prompt: 'Watermark appears on FREE tier exports. Upgrade to remove watermark.'
steps.expected: Subtle message or icon with tooltip explains watermark. Link to /settings/billing for upgrade.

steps.action: Click 'Upgrade' link from any upgrade prompt (banner, tooltip, modal)
steps.expected: Browser navigates to /en/settings/billing. Billing page loads showing 3 plans (FREE current, CREATOR upgrade CTA, PRO upgrade CTA). Current plan has blue border/badge. Upgrade buttons are enabled and linked to Stripe checkout.

steps.action: On billing page, verify CREATOR plan highlights: 30 carousels, 15 slides, no watermark, 8 style kits, 1 brand kit. Pricing shown ($X/month).
steps.expected: CREATOR plan card displays all features with checkmarks. Price is clearly visible. 'Upgrade to Creator' button is prominent (blue/purple).

steps.action: Return to dashboard without upgrading (browser back button), verify project count is now 3 of 3 (limit reached)
steps.expected: Dashboard shows 3 project cards. Carousel limit banner now shows 'You have reached your carousel limit (3/3). Upgrade to create more.' No 'Create New Carousel' button visible (or button disabled with tooltip).

steps.action: Verify user cannot create 4th carousel: try to access /en/create directly via URL
steps.expected: Create page redirects to dashboard with error message 'Carousel limit reached. Upgrade to Creator for 30 carousels.' OR create page loads but shows blocking upgrade modal preventing form access.

acceptance_criteria: UPGRADE PROMPT VISIBILITY: At least 4 upgrade prompts visible during journey (carousel limit banner, slide count dropdown, premium style kits, watermark explanation). Prompts are clear and non-intrusive.
FEATURE GATING: FREE tier limits strictly enforced: 8 slides max, 3 carousels max, 0 brand kits, 3 style kits, watermark on exports. User cannot bypass via UI manipulation.
MESSAGING CLARITY: All upgrade prompts explain WHAT is limited, WHY it's limited (tier), and HOW to upgrade (link to /settings/billing with specific plan recommendations).

ACTIONABLE LINKS: All 'Upgrade' links navigate to /settings/billing. Billing page loads successfully. Upgrade CTAs are functional (link to Stripe checkout - not tested in this journey, but buttons present).

NON-BLOCKING UX: Upgrade prompts do NOT prevent FREE tier users from using available features. User can successfully complete topic-to-export with FREE tier limits (8 slides, free style kit, watermark).
CONVERSION FUNNEL: User journey demonstrates clear upgrade incentives: more carousels, more slides, no watermark, more style kits, brand kits. Each prompt includes value proposition.
LIMIT ENFORCEMENT: Carousel limit (3/3) BLOCKS further carousel creation via UI AND via direct URL access to /en/create.
WATERMARK PRESENCE: FREE tier PDF export has 'QuickCarousals.com' watermark on all 8 pages. Watermark is visible but not obtrusive.
test_cases.notes: This test validates the MONETIZATION strategy. Upgrade prompts must convert FREE users to paid plans without frustrating them. Balance between 'too pushy' (annoying) and 'too subtle' (no conversions) is critical. Test should measure clarity and actionability of upgrade messaging, not actual Stripe payment flow.

test_cases.name: Unauthenticated API request returns 401
test_cases.description: Validates that all protected API endpoints reject requests without valid authentication tokens
test_cases.business_context: Preventing unauthorized access to API endpoints is fundamental security. Without auth enforcement, anyone could access user data, generate carousels, export files, and manipulate projects without an account.
preconditions: API endpoints are protected by withAuth() or withAuthAndErrors() middleware

steps.action: Send GET request to /api/projects WITHOUT Clerk authentication cookie/header
steps.expected: Request is intercepted by withAuthAndErrors middleware
Response status is 401 Unauthorized
Response body contains error object with code 'UNAUTHORIZED' and message 'Authentication required'

steps.action: Repeat test for POST /api/generate/topic, POST /api/brand-kits, POST /api/exports
steps.expected: All protected endpoints return 401 without authentication

acceptance_criteria: All protected API routes return 401 status code
Error response follows standard ApiError format: {error: {code, message, details}}
No sensitive data is leaked in error response
No partial execution occurs (middleware blocks before handler runs)
Public endpoints (health, webhooks, style-kits list) still work without auth
test_cases.notes: This is THE MOST CRITICAL security test. If auth middleware fails, entire data isolation model breaks. Test EVERY protected endpoint (there are 15+ endpoints). Public endpoints like /api/health, /api/webhooks/*, /api/style-kits should still return 200.

test_cases.name: User cannot access another user's projects
test_cases.description: Validates data isolation - authenticated users can only access their own projects, not projects belonging to other users
test_cases.business_context: Data isolation is core to multi-tenant SaaS security. If users can access each other's projects, it's a catastrophic privacy/security breach. Competitors could steal content, sensitive business information could be exposed.
preconditions: Two users exist: User A (with projects) and User B
User B is authenticated with valid session
User B knows the projectId of User A's project (obtained via enumeration or leak)

steps.action: User B sends GET request to /api/projects/[User A's projectId]
steps.expected: API verifies project ownership in route handler

steps.action: API queries Profile table to get User B's Profile.id from clerkUserId
steps.expected: Profile.id is retrieved successfully

steps.action: API queries Project table with WHERE id = [projectId] AND userId = [User B's Profile.id]
steps.expected: Query returns no results (project belongs to User A, not User B)
Response status is 404 Not Found (not 403, to avoid information disclosure)
Error message does not reveal whether project exists for another user

acceptance_criteria: Request returns 404 status code (not 403 which confirms project exists)
No project data is returned to User B
Error message is generic: 'Project not found' (not 'Project belongs to another user')
Database query includes userId filter in WHERE clause
Test applies to ALL resource endpoints: projects, brand-kits, exports, slides

known_issues.issue: No Batch Export for Multiple Projects
known_issues.description: Users must export projects one at a time. No API or UI for batch exporting multiple carousels simultaneously.
render-worker.ts line 350 hardcodes concurrency: 2. Cannot be configured via env var. May be too low for high-traffic scenarios or too high for low-resource environments.

Slides API verifies project ownership, but create page doesn't check if user actually owns the project before creating slides - potential race condition if project creation succeeds but returns someone else's project ID
Promise.all at line 176 creates all slides in parallel - if one fails, others may succeed, leaving partial carousel (no rollback/transaction)
User can click generate multiple times before first generation completes if they manipulate the disabled state or have slow network
If selectedStyleKit ID doesn't exist in database, generation succeeds but project references invalid styleKitId - no validation before API calls
projectCount is fetched on mount but not refreshed. If user has page open in multiple tabs and creates carousel in one tab, other tab still shows old count - could bypass limit check
Frontend enforces carousel limits, slide limits, style kit access - but backend APIs don't verify. Savvy user could bypass by manipulating requests

known_issues.issue: Error State Not Cleared on Mode Switch
known_issues.description: If user gets error in Topic mode then switches to Text mode, error banner persists until next generation attempt
Test page shows keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+E, Cmd+S, Cmd+D, Delete, Cmd+0, Cmd++, Cmd+-) but no keyboard event handlers exist in editor page component
handleLayoutChange (line 193) only updates layoutId, doesn't update layersBlueprint property - EditorCanvas must re-fetch or derive it
Back button (line 264) navigates without checking if auto-save is in-progress - could lose data if save is still running
If user navigates away before auto-save completes (500ms debounce + network time), changes may be lost
Line 103 JSON.parse(slide.content) could fail for corrupted data, would crash page instead of showing error state with try-catch
Header shows save status but no visual feedback DURING the PUT request (only after response) - user doesn't see when request starts
If GET /api/style-kits/:id fails (line 87-90), error shows generic 'Failed to load style kit' instead of more specific 'Failed to load project data'
Slide transformation (lines 112-115) uses empty strings/arrays as defaults, could cause issues if layers expect specific content structure
All operations wait for state update → auto-save → backend response, no optimistic UI updates during save (feels slower)
Test page mock save logs to console (line 230), but components might still make real API calls (styleKits, layouts) unless mocked

known_issues.issue: No User-Facing Error Message for API Failure
known_issues.description: If GET /api/projects fails, error is logged to console but no error banner/toast shown to user. Empty state appears which might confuse users who had projects.

known_issues.issue: No Retry Mechanism for Failed Project Load
known_issues.description: If API call fails on mount, user must refresh entire page to retry. No 'Retry' button or automatic retry logic.

known_issues.issue: Loading State Not Preserved on Navigation
known_issues.description: If user clicks back button during loading, loading state isn't cancelled. Fetch continues in background even after unmount (no AbortController).
formatDate function always uses 'en-US' locale (line 46) instead of using dynamic lang param from route. Should respect user's locale preference.
Projects are displayed in order returned by API (updatedAt desc), but no UI to change sort order (by title, created date, status, etc.).

known_issues.issue: No Backend Tier Enforcement for Premium Style Kits
known_issues.description: Frontend filters premium style kits by isPremium flag, but backend GET /api/style-kits doesn't verify user's subscription tier. Savvy users could bypass frontend filtering and use premium kits by manipulating API requests.

known_issues.issue: No Validation for Style Kit References
known_issues.description: Projects can reference styleKitId but no validation ensures the ID exists. If a style kit is deleted from database (manually), existing projects would reference invalid IDs causing rendering errors.

known_issues.issue: Gradient Background Rendering May Fail in Canvas
known_issues.description: Premium kit 'gradient_modern' uses CSS linear-gradient format for background. EditorCanvas (Konva.js) and render-slide.ts (@napi-rs/canvas) may not support CSS gradient strings - need special parsing/rendering logic.
